intro: Cracca laevigata, commonly known as the smooth cracca, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features slender, upright stems covered in fine, smooth hair. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and have a slightly rough texture. Cracca laevigata is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and gravelly areas.
